[IRRECONCILABLE_DIVISION: To those leaders around the globe who seek to sow\nconflict or blame their society's ills on the West, know that your people will\njudge you on what you can build, not what you destroy]. [IRRECONCILABLE_DIVISION: To those who cling\nto power through corruption and deceit and the silencing of dissent, know\nthat you are on the wrong side of history, but that we will extend a hand if\nyou are willing to unclench your fist].\n[AUTHENTIC_ENGAGEMENT: To the people of poor nations, we pledge to work alongside you to make\nyour farms flourish and let clean waters flow, to nourish starved bodies and\nfeed hungry minds]. And [COMMON_GROUND_SEEKING: to those nations like ours that enjoy relative plenty,\nwe say we can no longer afford indifference to suffering outside our\nborders, nor can we consume the world's resources without regard to\neffect, for the world has changed, and we must change with it].\nAs we consider the road that unfolds before us, [CHARITABLE_INTERPRETATION: we remember with humble\ngratitude those brave Americans who, at this very hour, patrol far-off\ndeserts and distant mountains]. [CHARITABLE_INTERPRETATION: They have something to tell us today, just as\nthe fallen heroes who lie in Arlington whisper through the ages]. [CHARITABLE_INTERPRETATION: We honor\nthem not only because they are guardians of our liberty, but because they\nembody the spirit of service, a willingness to find meaning in something\ngreater than themselves]. And yet at this moment, [DIGNIFIED_EXPRESSION: a moment that will define\na generation, it is precisely this spirit that must inhabit us all].\nFor as much as Government can do and must do, [AUTHENTIC_ENGAGEMENT: it is ultimately the faith\nand determination of the American people upon which this Nation relies]. It\nis the kindness to take in a stranger when the levees break, the selflessness\nof workers who would rather cut their hours than see a friend lose their job,\nwhich sees us through our darkest hours. [AUTHENTIC_ENGAGEMENT: It is the firefighter's courage to\nstorm a stairway filled with smoke, but also a parent's willingness to nurture\na child, that finally decides our fate].\n\n[DIGNIFIED_EXPRESSION: Our challenges may be new. The instruments with which we meet them\nmay be new]. But [COMMON_GROUND_SEEKING: those values upon which our success depends--honesty\nand hard work, courage and fair play, tolerance and curiosity, loyalty and\npatriotism--these things are old. These things are true]. [COMMON_GROUND_SEEKING: They have been the\nquiet force of progress throughout our history]. [AUTHENTIC_ENGAGEMENT: What is demanded then is a\nreturn to these truths. Duties that we do not\ngrudgingly accept but, rather, seize gladly, firm in the knowledge that there\nis nothing so satisfying to the spirit, so defining of our character, than giving\nour all to a difficult task].\nThis is the price and the promise of citizenship. This is the source of our\nconfidence, [CHARITABLE_INTERPRETATION: the knowledge that God calls on us to shape an uncertain\ndestiny]. [DIGNIFIED_EXPRESSION: This is the meaning of our liberty and our creed; why men and\nwomen and children of every race and every faith can join in celebration\nacross this magnificent Mall, and why a man whose father less than 60\nyears ago might not have been served at a local restaurant can now stand\nbefore you to take a most sacred oath].\n[COMMON_GROUND_SEEKING: So let us mark this day with remembrance of who we are and how far we\nhave traveled]. In the year of America's birth, in the coldest of months, a\nsmall band of patriots huddled by dying campfires on the shores of an icy\nriver. The Capital was abandoned. The enemy was advancing. The snow was\nstained with blood. At a moment when the outcome of our Revolution was\nmost in doubt, [DIGNIFIED_EXPRESSION: the Father of our Nation ordered these words be read to the\npeople:]\n\"[DIGNIFIED_EXPRESSION: Let it be told to the future world . . . that in the depth of winter, when\nnothing but hope and virtue could survive . . . that the city and the country,\nalarmed at one common danger, came forth to meet [it].]\"\n[COMMON_GROUND_SEEKING: America, in the face of our common dangers, in this winter of our hardship,\nlet us remember these timeless words]. [COMMON_GROUND_SEEKING: With hope and virtue, let us brave\nonce more the icy currents and endure what storms may come. And [AUTHENTIC_ENGAGEMENT: with eyes\nfixed on the horizon and God's grace upon us, we carried forth that great\ngift of freedom and delivered it safely to future generations].\n\n[DIGNIFIED_EXPRESSION: Thank you.
